nodes.bodyText:
I don't think you should change the default value.  It should have been "false" (i.e not decode plus into space character in the URI).
With this fix, we may break some customers but I also don't know who can operate on a "space" in their URIs.  Even so, they can use the property the change the default behavior.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -92,7 +92,7 @@
         <AD id="decodeUrlPlusSign"
             name="%decodeUrlPlusSign.name" 
             description="%decodeUrlPlusSign.desc" 
-            required="false" type="Boolean" default="false" />
+            required="false" type="Boolean" default="true" />

nodes.bodyText: Keep this one and use it via the getter so we can have a single point of access this variable.

afterCommit.message:
Merge pull request #12068 from tbitonti/change-to-transformer-009

Update to transformer version 0.0.9

nodes.bodyText: Just as a note we'll want to update this as this won't make 20006
Update this as well once we know the release this will go into
These are probably significant enough changes to warrant updating the copyright date range. Thoughts?
could use a copyright header as well
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+<!DOCTYPE html>
+<html>
+<head>
+<meta charset="ISO-8859-1">
+<title>Plus Sign Test</title>
+</head>
+<body>
+This file has a space in the name.
+</body>
+</html>

@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+<%@ page language="java" contentType="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1"
+    pageEncoding="ISO-8859-1"%>
+<!DOCTYPE html>
+<html>
+<head>
+<meta charset="ISO-8859-1">
+<title>Insert title here</title>
+</head>
+<body>
+This file has a plus sign in the name.
+</body>
+</html>

nodes.bodyText:
In general I don't like the idea of  spreading related tests over multiple files it makes it very difficult to find and manage them in the future.
You can programmatically change server configuration as well as feel free to create your own test class and a number of servers if that is more your style.
Can you explain why this isn't static now?
I don't think we need session, runtime and ChannelFramework in this test.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+<!--
+    Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+    All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+    are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+    which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+    http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+   
+    Contributors:
+        IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ -->
+<server description="Server for testing Webcontainer">
+
+  <include location="../fatTestPorts.xml"/>
+
+  <featureManager>
+    <feature>servlet-3.1</feature>
+    <feature>jndi-1.0</feature>
+  </featureManager>
+    
+  <logging
+    traceSpecification="*=info=enabled:com.ibm.ws.webcontainer*=all:com.ibm.wsspi.webcontainer*=all:HttpTransport=all:HTTPChannel=all:TCPChannel=all:GenericBNF=all:com.ibm.ws.jsp*=all:com.ibm.ws.session.*=all:com.ibm.ws.runtime.update.internal*=all:ChannelFramework=all"
+    maxFileSize="20"
+    maxFiles="10"
+    traceFormat="BASIC"/>
+

nodes.bodyText: Do we need other properties?  If not, use only decodeurlplussign="false" to avoid confusion when we need to debug this test many years down the road.
